intro: Sagina linnaei, commonly known as common pearlwort, is a low-growing flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces tiny white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring.
